customer_addr:
6629 Engle Road, Unit 108
Middleburg Heights, OH 44130

citations.narrative:
The facility is not maintaining records of acquisition for cats/kittens. The facility reports they last acquired kittens in
January 2024. Records showing acquisition of animals are important for disease traceback and in cases of suspected
theft. Every dealer must make, keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the following information:
name and address of the person from whom the animal was acquired; the USDA license or registration number of the
person from whom the animals were acquired; the vehicle license number and State and the driver's license and State of
the person; the name and address to whom the animal was given or sold; the date of the acquisition; a description of the
cat including the species and breed, sex, date of birth, and any distinctive markings of the animal; and the method of
transportation. Correct by ensuring complete records are made and maintained by the facility when cats/kittens are
acquired. Correct by: end of business June 11, 2024.

The facility is not maintaining records of acquisition for small mammals (excluding cats/kittens) and birds. Records
showing acquisition of animals are important for disease traceback and in cases of suspected theft. Every dealer must
make, keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the following information: name and address of the
person from whom the animal was acquired, the USDA license or registration number of the person from whom the
animals were acquired, the vehicle license number and State and the driver's license and State of the person, the name
and address to whom the animal was given or sold, the date of the acquisition, the species of the animal, and the number
of animals in the shipment. Correct by ensuring complete records are made and maintained by the facility when small
mammals or birds are acquired. Correct by: end of business June 11, 2024.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by August 10, 2024, or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility is not maintaining records of acquisition for cats/kittens. The facility reports they last acquired kittens in 
January 2024. Records showing acquisition of animals are important for disease traceback and in cases of suspected 
theft. Every dealer must make, keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the following information: 
name and address of the person from whom the animal was acquired; the USDA license or registration number of the 
person from whom the animals were acquired; the vehicle license number and State and the driver's license and State of 
the person; the name and address to whom the animal was given or sold; the date of the acquisition; a description of the 
cat including the species and breed, sex, date of birth, and any distinctive markings of the animal; and the method of 
transportation. Correct by ensuring complete records are made and maintained by the facility when cats/kittens are 
acquired. Correct by: end of business June 11, 2024. 
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility is not maintaining records of acquisition for small mammals (excluding cats/kittens) and birds. Records 
showing acquisition of animals are important for disease traceback and in cases of suspected theft. Every dealer must 
make, keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the following information: name and address of the 
person from whom the animal was acquired, the USDA license or registration number of the person from whom the 
animals were acquired, the vehicle license number and State and the driver's license and State of the person, the name 
and address to whom the animal was given or sold, the date of the acquisition, the species of the animal, and the number 
of animals in the shipment. Correct by ensuring complete records are made and maintained by the facility when small 
mammals or birds are acquired. Correct by: end of business June 11, 2024. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by August 10, 2024, or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.

Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
